messages.title: A GREEN NEW DEAL FOR TYNEDALE AND PONTELAND
messages.content: The Green New Deal is an economic reform package designed to combat climate breakdown and inequality. It will ensure a 'just transition' to a better society in which nobody gets left behind, benefiting people every bit as much as the environment. The Green New Deal was first proposed by a team that included Green Party MP Caroline Lucas. It is such a powerful idea that it has since been seized upon by other political parties across the world. Labour have renamed it the Green Industrial Revolution, but the Green New Deal is about more than just decarbonising – it is about rethinking how we live our lives and making positive changes across society.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Green Party believes that the UK is stronger in Europe and it believes in a People’s Vote. This message hasn’t changed since 2016. We want to remain in the EU and build on shared progress. People’s Vote will let people vote on a specific deal, to be aware of what they are choosing to go away from.

What would you do with an extra £86 per week? The Green Party has worked out a fully costed plan that would give all adults a basic income of £86 per week, at no net cost to the taxpayer. Universal Basic Income will ensure economic security for all, and it will enable people to work, study, care, volunteer, or set up a business.

issues.brexitEurope: The Green Party believes that the UK is stronger in Europe and it believes in a People’s Vote. This message hasn’t changed since 2016. We want to remain in the EU and build on shared progress.
issues.economy: Basic Income will ensure that everybody has the freedom to develop economic growth targets such as GDP will be replaced by wellbeing targets.
issues.labourEmployment: Basic Income will ensure economic security for all, and it will enable people to work, study, care, volunteer, or set up a business.
issues.transport: Transport will be safer, cheaper, and healthier for people and the planet.
issues.socialWelfare: Universal Basic Income will ensure economic security for all.

community.content: The Green New Deal will require a bottom-up transformation of the economy, setting us on a pathway to a better future where we live richer lives in stronger communities.

leaflet.personalStatement: A truly game-changing Green New Deal will require a bottom-up transformation of the economy, setting us on a pathway to a better future where we live richer lives in stronger communities.

images.caption: Green Party candidate for Hexham Nick Morphet would like to see a Green New Deal across the UK.

examples: no net cost to the taxpayer.
A truly game-changing Green New Deal will require a bottom-up transformation of the economy, setting us on a pathway to a better future where we live richer lives in stronger communities.
The Green Party believes that the UK is stronger in Europe and it believes in a People’s Vote.
People’s Vote will let people vote on a specific deal, to be aware of what they are choosing to go away from.
Basic Income will ensure economic security for all, and it will enable people to work, study, care, volunteer, or set up a business.

Labour have renamed it the Green Industrial Revolution, but the Green New Deal is about more than just decarbonising – it is about rethinking how we live our lives and making positive changes across society.
Transport will be safer, cheaper, and healthier for people and the planet.
Basic Income will ensure that everybody has the freedom to develop economic growth targets such as GDP will be replaced by wellbeing targets.

Nick Morphet, your local Green Party parliamentary candidate
